intro: Tarenna chevalieri, commonly known as the Madagascar star anise, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
